Others: The Indian senior men's team played their first match under head coach Manolo MÃ¡rquez in the Intercontinental Cup 2024.
The match was played at the GMC Balayogi Athletic Stadium in Hyderabad.
India kept the lion's share of the possession but lacked the cutting edge in attack against Mauritius.
Mauritius defended resolutely to claim a valuable point.
The scoreline remained 0-0 throughout the match.
India made a patient start, knocking the ball around calmly.
Anirudh Thapa's sixth-minute corner skimmed the back of Manvir Singh's head and almost fell for Chinglensana Singh rushing at the back post.
Mauritius didn't look too eager to press, but they pounced on every counter-attack opportunity they got.
India began to show more urgency as the first half progressed.
India finally tested Mauritius goalkeeper Kevin Jean-Louis in the 35th minute when Thapa brilliantly picked out Manvir Singh in the box.

Mauritius had their best chance of the first half in the 39th minute when Dyllan Collard laid the ball near the edge of the box for Emmanuel Vincent, who blasted a first-time shot a few inches above Amrinder Singh's crossbar.
India did create another decent chance at the stroke of half-time as Jay Gupta crossed to an unmarked Thapa just inside the 18-yard box.
Less than a minute after the restart, Chhangte swung a cross from the right and a tentative Jean-Louis required two attempts to keep it out of danger.
Mauritius got on the front foot in the second half, making inroads behind the Indian defence and being more creative.
India were up to the task defensively, while Les Dodos too weren't clinical enough in finishing.
India made several substitutions in the second half, including Sahal Abdul Samad, Nandhakumar Sekar, Suresh Singh Wangjam, and Subhasish Bose.
Ultimately, Mauritius held on for a vital point, and their skipper and defender Lyndsay Rose was named the player of the match.
AIFF President Shri Kalyan Chaubey presented him with a cheque of Rs. 1,00,000.
